isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 5.1: DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS - DWYER SLACK TUBE MANOMETER - FILLING

svcproc.title: FILLING
svcproc.para: The manometer may be filled with water, when checking very low pressures.

step1.para: When filling with water, use only good drinking water without additives except for some colored water vegetable dye which enables the tester to read the scale easier. With both legs of the manometer open to the atmosphere, fill the tube until the top of the fluid column is near the zero mark on the scale. Shake the tube to eliminate any air bubbles.

para.emph: NEVER USE AN ANTIFREEZE SOLUTION, SODA POP, TONIC, ETC. THE INCREASE IN DENSITY CAUSES FALSE READINGS.
